description: Construction of a two-storey detached dwellinghouse with basement level accommodation incorporating a basement, front/side lightwells, private amenity space, cycle parking and refuse storage (following demolition of the existing garage/outbuilding)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawing(s) and document(s): Proposed OS Plan drawing no.18-005-P01, Proposed Site Plan drawing no.18-005-P02, Proposed Ground Floor Plan drawing no.18-005-P03, Proposed Basement Plan drawing no.18-005-P04,  Proposed Roof Plan drawing no.18-005-P06,  Proposed Street Elevation drawing no.18-005-P07,  Proposed Front Elevation drawing no.18-005-P08,  Proposed Side Elevation (East) drawing no.18-005-P09, Proposed Rear Elevation drawing no. 18-005-P10, Proposed Side Elevation (West) drawing no. 18-005-P11, 18-005 Tree Protection Plan, 18-005 Tree Survey Plan, Arboricultural Impact Assessment and 18-005 Arboricultural Method Statement
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed on the submitted application form and the approved plans as listed in Condition (2).

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.10, and policies D1 and D2 of the Draft New London Plan (2018).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - I of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, no permitted development shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To ensure orderly development, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f),  2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies D4, D1 and D2 of the Draft New London Plan (2018).

| Cycle storage for a minimum of two (2) bicycles in accordance with all adopted standards and as per approved plans - Condition 2 shall be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
REASON: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T4 and T5 of the Draft New London Plan (2018).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - Section 12 Achieving well-designed places.

| The approved landscape, retention of trees and tree protection details shall be carried out as per submitted 18-005 Tree Protection Plan, 18-005 Tree Survey Plan, Arboricultural Impact Assessment and 18-005 Arboricultural Method Statement prior to the occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained for the duration of the development. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area as a whole, in pursuance to the objectives of section 12 and 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, policies D2, G1 and G7 of the Draft New London Plan (2018), policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations'.

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a demolition method statement and construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Details shall include control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policy D2 of the Draft New London Plan (2018) and policies Ealing Local Variation of London Plan Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan
